snippet: Xi Jinping reappeared on Saturday as diplomatic tensions boiled over, with hundreds of demonstrators throwing rocks and eggs at the Japanese Embassy in Beijing.
abstract: Reappearance in Beijing of China's Vice Pres Xi Jinping, who had vanished from public view, removes one question mark facing the Communist Party but a wave of protests against Japan, over control of small group of islands in East China Sea, is a sign that internal power struggles are far from over.

byline.original: By IAN JOHNSON and JANE PERLEZ

lead_paragraph: Xi Jinping reappeared on Saturday as diplomatic tensions boiled over, with hundreds of demonstrators throwing rocks and eggs at the Japanese Embassy in Beijing.

headline.seo: Xi Jinping Returns Amid Tumult in China
headline.main: A Chinese Leader Returns Amid Tumult
headline.print_headline: A Chinese Leader Returns Amid Tumult
